label: FGS212
info_overview: Remotely Controlled Relay Switch of Fibaro System is designed to operate in a wall switch box or in locations where the control of an electric device is needed.
info_inclusion:
Fibaro Switch must be placed within the range of Home Center
controller, as adding mode requires direct communication with the
controller.

Find key no. 1 which allows to switch circuit 1 on, in accordance
with the diagram
During the installation it is recommended to use a
momentary key connected to S1.

Add Fibaro Switch to the network by pushing three times key no. 1
or push-button B located inside the housing of the device. For
toggle switch perform 3 position changes.

The controller indicates when the device is correctly added to the
network.

CAUTION
Fibaro Switch cancels the "learning" mode after
key no. 1 is pressed once. Therefore, pressing key
no. 1 four times will not add the devices to the
network. The same applies to push-button B.
info_exclusion:
Find key no. 1 which allows to switch circuit 1 on, in accordance
with the diagram
During removing it is recommended to use a
momentary key connected to S1.

Remove Fibaro Switch from the network by pushing three times key no. 1
or push-button B located inside the housing of the device. For
toggle switch perform 3 position changes.

The controller indicates when the device is correctly removed from the
network.
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

options.label: ALL ON disabled / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON disabled / ALL OFF active
ALL ON active / ALL OFF disabled
ALL ON active / ALL OFF active

parameters.label: Override OFF-delay
parameters.overview: If Parameter 4 states an auto off period, this parameter enable the possibility to turn off the relay with a button push. Default value 0 disallow turn off with a button push during the auto off interval.

options.label: Turn off with push button disabled
options.overview: Turn off with push button disabled in auto off interval

options.label: Turn off with push button enabled
options.overview: Turn off with push button enabled in auto off interval

parameters.label: Relay 1: OFF-delay time (100ms steps)
parameters.description: Automatic turning off relay 1 after set time ...

parameters.label: Separation of association sending (key 1)
parameters.description: Sending commands to control devices assigned ...
parameters.overview:
to 1-st association group (key no. 1)

- Also see param #15

options.label: Map status to all devices in group 1
options.overview: Commands are sent when device is turned on and off

options.label: Map OFF status to all devices in group 1  ...
options.overview: Enabling device does not send control commands. Double-clicking key sends 'turn on' command, dimmers memorize the last saved state (e.g. 50% brightness)

options.label: Map OFF status to all devices in group 1 ...
options.overview: Enabling device does not send control commands. Double-clicking key sends 'turn on' command and dimmers are set to 100% brightness.

parameters.label: Inputs behaviour
parameters.description: Assigns bistable key status to the device status.
parameters.overview:
Available configuration parameters:
0 - [On / Off] device changes status on key status change.
1 - Device status depends on key status: ON when the key is ON, OFF when the key is OFF

options.label: Toggle
Follow switch contact (closed=ON, open=OFF)
Mono-stable input (button)
Bi-stable input (switch)

parameters.label: Dimmer/Roller shutter control
parameters.description: Enable/Disable operation of dimmer or roller shutter devices ...
parameters.overview: enabling this option allows the user to dim lighting/shut roller by associating Dimmer/Roller Shutter Controller and holding or double press of double switch (only mono-stable switch).

options.label: Disable Dimmer/Roller shutter control
Enable Dimmer/Roller shutter control
